SEARCH
Module com.example.notesmanager
Package com.example.notesmanager

Class RegisterWindow

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.example.notesmanager.RegisterWindow
public class RegisterWindow extends javafx.application.Application
The RegisterWindow class extends the Application class and represents the registration window of the application. It contains fields for the stage, scene, and root of the application, as well as input fields for the user's name, email, and password.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method of the application. It calls the launch method inherited from the Application class to start the JavaFX application.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      The start method is the entry point for the JavaFX application. It is called after the init method has returned, and after the system is ready for the application to begin running.

      It sets the primary stage for the application, loads the register window FXML file, sets the scene, and displays the stage.

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during loading the FXML file or setting the scene.

    • createAccount

      public void createAccount(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      This method is called when the create account button is clicked. It retrieves the user's name, email, and password from the input fields, checks if they are in the correct format, and if the entered passwords match.

      If the format of all fields is correct and both of the entered passwords match, it creates a user account in the database and returns the corresponding User object. If the userID equals -1, it means the email already exists in the database and an alert is shown to the user. If the userID is 0, it means the database returned an IntegrityConstraintViolation and an alert is shown to the user. If the userID is greater than 0, it means the user has been successfully created and an alert is shown to the user. After the user clicks on the OK button of the alert, it navigates to the MainWindow.

      If the format of any field is incorrect or the entered passwords do not match, it shows an alert informing the user to verify their inputs.

      Parameters:
      e - the action event
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during navigation

    • backToLogin

      public void backToLogin(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      This method is called when the back to login button is clicked. It loads the login window FXML file, sets the scene, and displays the stage.
      Parameters:
      e - the action event
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during loading the FXML file or setting the scene.
